What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 6 and 8?

What is 2/3 + 1/6?
What is 12 squared minus 6 squared?
If 2^x = 1024, what is x?
What is the only even prime number?
How many perfect squares exist between 1 and 100 (inclusive)?
What is the smallest number divisible by 1 through 10?
In the Fibonacci sequence, what comes after 34?
What is the digital root of 9999? (Sum digits until single digit)
If a triangle has angles 45° and 45°, what is the third angle?
What is 1111 in binary converted to decimal?
How many edges does a cube have?
What is the only number equal to the sum of its proper divisors (excluding itself)?
If 3 cats catch 3 mice in 3 minutes, how many cats catch 100 mice in 100 minutes?
What is the next shape in this sequence: triangle, square, pentagon, ___?
What is the probability of flipping heads twice in a row?
How many zeros are at the end of 10 factorial (10!)?
What is the area of a circle with circumference 20π?
If 5 machines make 5 widgets in 5 minutes, how long for 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
What is the smallest positive integer that is neither prime nor composite?
How many times does the digit '9' appear from 1 to 100?
What is the only integer that is neither positive nor negative?
If you fold a standard paper in half 7 times, how many layers are created?
What is the sum of all numbers on a standard die (1-6)?
How many perfect cubes exist between 1 and 500?
What is the only number spelled with letters in alphabetical order?
If 3 people can paint 3 fences in 3 hours, how many people are needed to paint 9 fences in 9 hours?
What is the maximum number of pieces you can get with 5 straight cuts through a cake?
Which number when multiplied by itself gives the same result as when added to itself?
How many prime numbers end with the digit 5?
What is the only single-digit number with exactly three letters in its English name?
If 1/2 of 5 is 3, what is 1/3 of 10?
What is the smallest positive integer that can be written as the sum of two cubes in two different ways?
questions.fun_fact: Known as the Hardy-Ramanujan number, called the 'taxicab number' as it's the smallest number expressible as the sum of two cubes in two different ways (1³ + 12³ and 9³ + 10³).

questions.question: How many zeros does a googol (10^100) have when written out?
questions.fun_fact: A googol is 1 followed by 100 zeros, and inspired the name 'Google' (with intentional misspelling).

questions.question: What shape has the most surface area for a given volume?
questions.fun_fact: You can create shapes with infinite surface area but finite volume, like Gabriel's Horn.

questions.question: Which prime number is the sum of all digits on a standard calculator (1+2+3+4+5+6+7+8+9)?
questions.trick: Trick question! 45 isn't prime - the correct answer is that none are prime.

questions.question: If you shuffle a deck of cards perfectly 8 times, what happens?
questions.fun_fact: Perfect shuffles (where the deck splits exactly in half) follow a predictable 8-cycle pattern.

questions.question: What percentage of numbers contain the digit '9' when counting from 1 to 100?
questions.explanation: 19 numbers have '9's (9,19...99), but 99 has two, making 20 total occurrences.

questions.question: How many times can you subtract 5 from 25?
questions.explanation: After subtracting 5 once, you're working with 20, not 25 anymore!

questions.question: What is the only number whose letters are in alphabetical order when spelled out in English?
questions.fun_fact: F-O-R-T-Y is the only number with this property when considering proper spelling.

questions.question: What is the probability that two random numbers share no common factors?
questions.fun_fact: This surprising result is related to the Riemann zeta function.

questions.question: Which shape has a larger perimeter: a circle or square with equal area?
questions.explanation: For fixed area, circles minimize perimeter while squares have about 12.5% more perimeter.

questions.question: How many times do the hour and minute hands of a clock overlap in 12 hours?
questions.fun_fact: They overlap every 65+5/11 minutes, not every hour!

questions.question: What is the smallest number divisible by every digit 1-9?
What digit appears most frequently when counting from 1 to 999?
questions.explanation: Benford's Law shows '1' appears as leading digit ~30% of the time in many real-world datasets.

questions.question: How many colors are needed to color any map so no touching areas share a color?
questions.fun_fact: Proven in 1976 using computers, establishing the Four Color Theorem.

questions.question: What is the only number that is one more than the sum of its digits squared?
questions.proof: 2² + 5² = 4 + 25 = 29 ≠ 25; Trick question - there is no such number!

questions.question: What is the probability of two people sharing a birthday in a 23-person group?
questions.explanation: The Birthday Paradox shows probability exceeds 50% with just 23 people due to combinatorial explosion.

questions.question: Which is larger: the number of possible chess games or atoms in the universe?
questions.fun_fact: Estimated 10^120 chess games vs ~10^80 atoms in the observable universe.

questions.question: What is the only integer that is exactly twice the sum of its digits?
How many trailing zeros does 100! (100 factorial) have?
questions.explanation: Count pairs of (2,5) factors - limited by fives since there are more twos.

questions.question: What is the smallest number that is spelled with the letter 'a'?
questions.fun_fact: No number before 1000 contains the letter 'a' in English.

questions.question: If you walk halfway to a wall, then half the remaining distance, and repeat forever, do you reach the wall?
What is the only number whose letters are in reverse alphabetical order when spelled out?
questions.fun_fact: O-N-E is in reverse alphabetical order (O > N > E).

questions.question: What is the only integer that cannot be represented in Roman numerals?
questions.fun_fact: Ancient Romans had no concept of zero as a number.

questions.question: If you flip a fair coin 100 times, what's the probability of getting exactly 50 heads?
questions.explanation: Counterintuitively low due to the central limit theorem - most results cluster near 50 but exact 50 is rare.
